pull.title: Wallet refactoring leading up to multiwallet
pull.body: Part of the refactorings needed for basic multiwallet (#8694)

events.body:
@luke-jr Mind to solve the merge conflict?

Also, assigned 0.14 milestone, I think this is relatively trivial/uncontroversial refactoring.

events.message: Wallet: Let the interval-flushing thread figure out the filename
Wallet: Split main logic from InitLoadWallet into CreateWalletFromFile

events.body: @jonasschnelli Are your comments addressed by the feedback?

issue.title: Make nWalletDBUpdated atomic to avoid a potential race.
[Wallet][Refactoring] wallet/init refactoring backports
issue.body:
Adapts the following refactoring PRs:

- bitcoin/bitcoin#6961 Constrain constant values to a single location in code
- bitcoin/bitcoin#7576 [Wallet] move wallet help string creation to CWallet
- bitcoin/bitcoin#7577 move "load wallet phase" to CWallet
- bitcoin/bitcoin#7608 Move hardcoded file name out of log messages
- bitcoin/bitcoin#7691 refactor wallet/init interaction
- bitcoin/bitcoin#8776 Wallet refactoring leading up to multiwallet

comments.body:
In theory, this should only be done when holding cs_wallet. I guess changing CWallet::strWalletFile to a `const std::string` is not possible with the current concept of setting the filename in a instance method.
But maybe I'm wrong.
Heh. This (unchanged) comment was wrong before and correct after this PR. :)
Maybe declare `CreateWalletFromFile()` private to avoid layer confusion?
wallet.h says "This lock protects all the fields added by CWallet except for: ... strWalletFile (immutable after instantiation)"
It's not really intended to be private...
